Description: For the given numeral, predict whether the specimen was obtained from 1) biopsy (true) or polypectomy (false), and whether the pathologist rated the specimen as 2) hyperplastic polyps, 3) low-grade dysplasia, 4) high-grade dysplasia, 5) cancer, 6) serrated polyps, or 7) non-informative. Give a true or false answer for each of the categories.

reasoning.description: The thought process leading to the final answer.

biopsy.description: True if the specimen was obtained from a biopsy, false if it was obtained from a polypectomy.

hyperplastic_polyps.description: True if the pathologist rated the specimen as hyperplastic polyps, false otherwise.

low_grade_dysplasia.description: True if the pathologist rated the specimen as low-grade dysplasia, false otherwise.

high_grade_dysplasia.description: True if the pathologist rated the specimen as high-grade dysplasia, false otherwise.

cancer.description: True if the pathologist rated the specimen as cancer, false otherwise.

serrated_polyps.description: True if the pathologist rated the specimen as serrated polyps, false otherwise.

non_informative.description: True if the pathologist rated the specimen as non-informative, false otherwise.
